modules.name: Digital Visual Design
modules.information: Digital Visual Design introduces students to the knowledge, skills, and practice in visualizing, designing, and developing highly contemporary and professional interfaces for all of their working and usable digital artifacts.

modules.name: Digital Storytelling
modules.information: Digital Storytelling introduces a variety of media-making techniques and approaches to interactivity that serves storytelling.

modules.name: Code Lab I
modules.information: CodeLab I is a rapid prototyping workshop series that introduces the fundamentals of procedural programming.

modules.name: Creative Coding
modules.information: Creative Coding is a practice that uses code for artistic or creative expression. This can cover a wide variety of media including generative art, animation, data visualization, games, apps, robotics, music, interactive art, immersive experiences – and many more.

modules.name: Web Dev I
modules.information: The web is rapidly becoming the go-to environment for deploying and using the software. We rely on web technologies to manage our work and social lives, collaborate with like-minded people, experience art, and be entertained.

resources.title: Essential Guide to Frontend Technical Documentation

modules.name: Ideation & UX Design
modules.information: The aim of this module is to expose the full design cycle, from the initial idea generation and analysis, audience research, and user profiling, through the interface design (across device types) and prototype development, to testing, evaluation, and iteration.

modules.name: Code Lab II
modules.information: CodeLab II extends your knowledge of coding to include object-oriented programming (OOP).

modules.name: Web Dev II
modules.information: Web Dev II builds on the HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript programming skills covered in Web Dev I. Following an HTML5 and CSS refresher, students will be introduced to more advanced CSS techniques that they will use throughout the module to create engaging, responsive, and well-designed web content

modules.name: Indie Game Design
modules.information: In this module, students develop a 2D game from concept to completion, and in doing so, engage the function and responsibilities of all key roles to gain an understanding of the full ‘game development ecosystem.

modules.name: Emerging Technologies
modules.information: Discover the latest trends and tools shaping the future of technology, from AI to data visualization.

modules.name: Creative Industry Challenge
modules.information: Work on a real-world project, integrating creative skills and technologies to solve practical challenges.

modules.name: Smartphone Apps
modules.information: Design and develop mobile applications, focusing on Android environments and user-centered design.

modules.name: Machine Learning
modules.information: Learn the fundamentals of visual communication and digital design using modern tools and workflows.

modules.name: Creative Incubator
modules.information: Creative Incubator is about exploring the commercial viability of students' digital ideas. It helps them transform proposals for new digital products or services into commodifiable prototypes.

modules.name: Cyber Security
modules.information: All businesses face the threat of their IT systems being compromised. The impact of a successful attack is often expensive in terms of time and money for the businesses and individuals affected.

modules.name: Physical Computing
modules.information: Physical Computing helps make the inanimate, animate. It provides the knowledge and tools to help students create functional or artistic pieces that are tangible, driven by real-world data, and possible to deploy in a wide range of scenarios.

modules.name: Research Project
modules.information: The Research Project is a compressed research module where the output is a research report. Students form a research question in the field of creative computing, identify appropriate research methods for addressing the question, undertake the research, and then defend their work.

modules.name: Tomorrow's Web
modules.information: This module builds on the front-end development techniques encountered in Web Dev II and introduces back-end techniques to develop creative database-driven web apps. Students learn how to handle database information, perform queries and use the results to deliver dynamic content to the end user.

modules.name: Fundamentals of Cyber Security
modules.information: Cyber security has been defined as one of the key threats to the prosperity of the United Kingdom by the government, while similar conclusions have been drawn across the globe. The threat to individuals, businesses and the public sector has never been greater.

modules.name: Introduction to Computing
modules.information: Computer Science is all about effective problem solving using data. But what, exactly, is data, and what do we need to know about it? How can we use it? What problems can there be in its use and storage? In this module you will learn what data is, how it is represented, manipulated, processed, stored, transferred, error-checked and compressed.

modules.name: Code Lab I
modules.information: CodeLab I is a rapid prototyping workshop series that introduces the fundamentals of procedural programming.

modules.name: Databases
modules.information: This module provides an introduction to the design, creation and use of databases. It exposes particularly the function of relational databases, and the various data modelling approaches required to create solutions that are organised efficiently, robust and secure.

modules.name: Web Dev I
modules.information: The web is rapidly becoming the go-to environment for deploying and using the software. We rely on web technologies to manage our work and social lives, collaborate with like-minded people, experience art, and be entertained.

resources.title: Essential Guide to Frontend Technical Documentation

modules.name: Digital Forensics
modules.information: Digital forensics concerns techniques for recovering and analysing material found on computing devices. Often leveraged to investigate instances of cyber crime but also network intrusion and other forms of legal dispute, the field has in recent years gained significant relevance for both the private and public sector.

modules.name: Code Lab II
modules.information: CodeLab II extends your knowledge of coding to include object-oriented programming (OOP).

modules.name: Web Dev II
modules.information: Web Dev II builds on the HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript programming skills covered in Web Dev I. Following an HTML5 and CSS refresher, students will be introduced to more advanced CSS techniques that they will use throughout the module to create engaging, responsive, and well-designed web content

modules.name: Indie Game Design
modules.information: In this module, students develop a 2D game from concept to completion, and in doing so, engage the function and responsibilities of all key roles to gain an understanding of the full ‘game development ecosystem.

modules.name: Emerging Technologies
modules.information: Discover the latest trends and tools shaping the future of technology, from AI to data visualization.

modules.name: Creative Industry Challenge
modules.information: Work on a real-world project, integrating creative skills and technologies to solve practical challenges.

modules.name: Smartphone Apps
modules.information: Design and develop mobile applications, focusing on Android environments and user-centered design.

modules.name: Machine Learning
modules.information: Learn the fundamentals of visual communication and digital design using modern tools and workflows.

modules.name: Creative Incubator
modules.information: Creative Incubator is about exploring the commercial viability of students' digital ideas. It helps them transform proposals for new digital products or services into commodifiable prototypes.

modules.name: Cyber Security
modules.information: All businesses face the threat of their IT systems being compromised. The impact of a successful attack is often expensive in terms of time and money for the businesses and individuals affected.

modules.name: Physical Computing
modules.information: Physical Computing helps make the inanimate, animate. It provides the knowledge and tools to help students create functional or artistic pieces that are tangible, driven by real-world data, and possible to deploy in a wide range of scenarios.

modules.name: Research Project
modules.information: The Research Project is a compressed research module where the output is a research report. Students form a research question in the field of creative computing, identify appropriate research methods for addressing the question, undertake the research, and then defend their work.

modules.name: Tomorrow's Web
modules.information: This module builds on the front-end development techniques encountered in Web Dev II and introduces back-end techniques to develop creative database-driven web apps. Students learn how to handle database information, perform queries and use the results to deliver dynamic content to the end user.

modules.name: Creative Photography
modules.information: This module will develop the student’s digital photography skills, as they devise a creative photography concept and deliver an individual creative portfolio. Using accessible technology, including mobile phones, students will gain an awareness of the principles of creative photography, such as focus, colour, composition, angle, exposure and shutter.

resources.title: The Beginner’s Guide to Lightroom Mobile

modules.name: Short Film Drama
modules.information: The module will introduce students to basic use of lighting, camera, audio and editing technique and practice. The module will more broadly cover the process and workflow of media production.

modules.name: Digital Content Creation
modules.information: The module aims to expose students to creative approaches to management and a managed approach to creativity, which can be transferred and developed to different scenarios across Levels 5 and 6.

modules.name: Storytelling for Content Creation
modules.information: This module will help you enhance your creative skills to become a critically aware and resilient content creator. You will develop skills that allow you to create content for a range of audiences and contexts.

modules.name: Digital Practice
modules.information: Digital Practice introduces the production of a variety of digital media (text, still and moving image, audio). It examines the use of digital media, and its platforms (TV, web, mobile, console) in a variety of cultural and social contexts in an attempt to form an understanding of how we consume, and rely on, digital media today.

modules.name: Short Film Documentary
modules.information: The module builds on FTV4004-20 and further develops your skills in the use of lighting, camera, audio and editing techniques.  However, the emphasis in this module is on documentary storytelling (in contrast to FTV4004-20’s focus on fiction).

modules.name: Everyday Media Making
modules.information: Everyday Media Making explores the premise that media making can: empower people through connecting expose, challenge and critique dominant cultures provoke different ways of thinking/seeing embody participatory practices

modules.name: Advanced Digital Practice
modules.information: This module builds on the programme’s emphasis on helping students to become critically engaged, and socially conscious, multi-platform digital content creators.

modules.name: Participatory Media
modules.information: This module explores the theory and practices of participatory arts and media, focussing on the latter. Henry Jenkins (2016) a key writer on participatory cultures notes that at a time of eroded public trust in core institutions and mainstream media increasingly concentrated into the hands of a few conglomerates, ‘grass roots media’ is ‘being deployed as the tool by which to challenge the failed mechanisms of institutional politics’.

modules.name: Visual Effects 1
modules.information: The aim of this module is to provide an introduction to digital effects and animation processes and techniques, to ensure you are well equipped to begin to contribute to a professional film, television and digital production environment.

modules.name: Commissioning Content Creation
modules.information: This module aims to give students an understanding of commissioning in the media and securing freelance employment.

modules.name: Promotional Media
modules.information: Examining the role of promotional media materials such as trailers, idents, social media, movie reviewers, ARGs, branded leisure attractions, PR, and the type of online user-generated content circulating between and beyond the main media products of creative industries, this module investigates the role of such promotional media on informing audience behaviours and fandoms amongst contemporary audiences.

modules.name: Creative Media Enterprise
modules.information: This module requires you to extend your knowledge of your creative media specialisms by taking your interests out into the “real” world via negotiated project work.

modules.name: Professional Practice
modules.information: This module examines the media and creative industries in terms of working practices; funding and entrepreneurial business opportunities; national and regional industry contexts and generating and developing ideas.

modules.name: Digital Innovation and Enterprise
modules.information: This module will focus on professional digital media innovation practice and aims to connect with best practice approaches used today within the digital production industry.

modules.name: Personal Project
modules.information: This module can take a variety of forms – from experimental practice within a creative specialism through to work created as part of an experiential learning experience or arising from a live brief.

modules.name: Introduction to Psychology
modules.information: This module will develop the student’s digital photography skills, as they devise a creative photography concept and deliver an individual creative portfolio. Using accessible technology, including mobile phones, students will gain an awareness of the principles of creative photography, such as focus, colour, composition, angle, exposure and shutter.

resources.title: Coursera: Introduction to Psychology by Yale

modules.information: The module will introduce students to basic use of lighting, camera, audio and editing technique and practice. The module will more broadly cover the process and workflow of media production.

modules.name: Research Report
modules.information: This module can take a variety of forms – from experimental practice within a creative specialism through to work created as part of an experiential learning experience or arising from a live brief.

modules.information: This module can take a variety of forms – from experimental practice within a creative specialism through to work created as part of an experiential learning experience or arising from a live brief.

modules.name: Advanced Topics in Psychology
modules.information: This module can take a variety of forms – from experimental practice within a creative specialism through to work created as part of an experiential learning experience or arising from a live brief.

modules.name: The Business Environment
modules.information: Explore how businesses operate in different environments (economic, legal, political, and global), and the external forces that impact them.

modules.name: Managing Data
modules.information: Learn how to gather, analyze, and present data to support decision-making in business.

modules.name: Professional Practice
modules.information: Develop essential skills such as communication, teamwork, time management, and professional ethics.

modules.name: Organizational Behavior & Management
modules.information: Study how people behave in organizations, including motivation, leadership, and team dynamics.

modules.name: Economics & Globalization
modules.information: Understand key economic theories and the impact of globalization on business strategies.

modules.name: Design Thinking for Enterprise
modules.information: Learn how to use design thinking to solve problems creatively in a business context

modules.name: Marketing
modules.information: Understand core marketing concepts like segmentation, targeting, positioning, and branding

modules.name: The Marketing Business / Marketing in Practice
modules.information: Apply marketing strategies in real business scenarios, including digital marketing and campaigns.

modules.name: Creativity for Business
modules.information: Explore how creativity drives innovation and competitive advantage in business.

modules.name: Operations and Project Management
modules.information: Learn how to manage business processes, logistics, and projects efficiently.

modules.name: Human Resource Management / in Practice
modules.information: Study the principles and application of HRM, including recruitment, performance, and legal aspects.

modules.name: Innovation Management
modules.information: Learn how companies foster innovation and manage it strategically

modules.name: Organisational Strategy
modules.information: Explore strategic analysis, planning, and implementation within organizations.

modules.name: Enterprise: Creating Your Own Business
modules.information: Take your business idea from concept to execution with support from mentors.

modules.name: International Marketing
modules.information: Understand global marketing strategies, cultural factors, and international branding.

modules.name: Strategic Human Resource Management
modules.information: Align HR strategies with long-term business goals and evaluate performance.

modules.name: Marketing Research Project / Human Resource Management Research Project
modules.information: Conduct an independent research project in your chosen specialism (marketing or HRM).

modules.name: Managing Sustainability
modules.information: Understand sustainable business practices and how to integrate them strategically.

modules.name: Business Environment
modules.information: Explore external and internal factors affecting how businesses operate, including political, economic, social, technological, legal, and environmental influences.

modules.name: Managing Data
modules.information: Learn how to gather, analyze, and present data to support decision-making in business.

modules.name: Financial Accounting for Business Enterprise
modules.information: Introduction to financial accounting principles, preparation of financial statements, and understanding double-entry bookkeeping.

modules.name: Organisational Behaviour and Management
modules.information: :Examines how people behave within organizations and the impact of management practices.

modules.name: Economics and Globalisation
modules.information: Introduces basic economic principles and the impact of globalization on business.

modules.name: Cost and Management Accounting
modules.information: Focuses on budgeting, costing techniques, and internal reporting for decision-making.

modules.name: Creativity for Business
modules.information: Develop creative thinking and innovation in business contexts to generate new ideas and solve problems.

modules.name: Business Law
modules.information: Understand the legal frameworks that affect businesses, including contracts, company law, employment law, and regulatory compliance.

modules.name: UK Taxation
modules.information: Introduces personal and business taxation in the UK, including income tax, VAT, and corporate tax.

modules.name: Performance Management
modules.information: Learn how to manage business processes, logistics, and projects efficiently.

modules.name: Innovation Management
modules.information: Learn how companies foster innovation and manage it strategically

modules.name: Human Resource Management / in Practice
modules.information: Study the principles and application of HRM, including recruitment, performance, and legal aspects.

modules.name: Managing Sustainability
modules.information: Understand sustainable business practices and how to integrate them strategically.

modules.name: Financial Management
modules.information: Focuses on financial decision-making, capital budgeting, and working capital management.

modules.name: Financial Reporting
modules.information: Examines the preparation and analysis of complex financial statements in accordance with IFRS.

modules.name: Accounting Project
modules.information: A capstone project involving independent research in an accounting-related topic.

modules.name: Audit and Assurance
modules.information: Introduces auditing processes, ethics, risk, and assurance services.
